meanings.definition: Work hard over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: She slogged through her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: The team slogged through the tough training sessions.
meanings.sent3: He slogged through the muddy field to get to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The students slogged through the challenging exam with determination.
meanings.sent5: The hiker slogged up the steep mountain trail, step by step.

meanings.definition: Walk or move with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog slogged along the path.
meanings.sent2: We slogged through the thick mud in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The snail slogged its way across the garden, taking its time.
meanings.sent4: The old car slogged up the steep hill, struggling to reach the top.
meanings.sent5: The worker slogged back home after a long day on his feet.
